Journal Story: Started my AT hike at 12:30 pm Registered hike #515 my pack weighed in at 38.8 pounds with full food and water.
really cold night last night, barely slept but got on the trail early and made good time getting to justice spring.
Great night alone at justice spring. Had some great views from blood mountian, highest point in Georgia.
Bought an under quilt for my hammock which added 20 degrees of protection. Only did 11 miles today to baby my blisters from yesterday. Shelter here at Low gap is crowded.

It was 9 degrees last night. My boots froze solid at the 4000 feet elevation up here. But the view is incredible and it's not raining anymore. Heading into my first town today. Went out with Trench foot and Nomad to a Mexican place. Best quesadilla I ever had.

Long day of hiking today. Pouring rain and thick fog since I woke up. Boots soaked thru by mile 3 and it made my feet really heavy. Met a good group at Unicoi gap and we all camped at the top of Tray mountian.

My first week. My water filter froze last night but luckily I have people here who are willing to let me use their filter. I also found a pair of gators at the camp site last night, the trail provides. Crossed the state line into NC today! Really exciting got one state down.
Beautiful day of hiking. Negative 1 degree at muskrat last night but the views going to Betty Creek were gorgeous. Easy 17 mile day.
